news_header: A crush at a Hindu festival in India may have resulted in numerous fatalities, while various political and environmental events unfold in Asia.
news_text: Dozens are feared dead in a crush at the Kumbh Mela, the world's largest Hindu festival, in Prayagraj, India. Meanwhile, Thai authorities have made public transport free for a week to combat air pollution. In South Korea, impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol faces mounting pressure as lawmakers vote on his impeachment amidst protests. A 7.1 magnitude earthquake has caused significant casualties, and investigations continue into a Jeju Air crash. The situation remains tense with public reactions to political developments.
